page.title: 15Housing in Soulbury
page.content: There are approximately 210 houses in the Soulbury area, nearly all of which are one family units. The majority are privately owned, each with varying areas of land and garden attached. There are approximately 60 council houses owned by Aylesbury Vale District Council which are rented to families on a points allocation system. There are between 15 and 20 farmhouses occupied by the families operating the farmland although some farmhouses have been sold off as farms have been amalgamated. Houses of historic architectural interest were listed and recorded by a survey conducted and updated in 1984. These properties are now protected from demolition and structural alterations. Planning permission for development and new houses has to be authorised by the Parish council.
